title: Asia markets mixed as investors await a slew of inflation data and central bank decisions this week
content: Traders will watch out for central bank releases, including the Bank of Korea's rate decision and minutes of the Reserve Bank of Australia's August meeting.
summary: Traders will watch out for central bank releases, including the Bank of Korea's rate decision and minutes of the Reserve Bank of Australia's August meeting.

title: In major policy shift, Singapore announces unemployment support scheme
content: The scheme will give laid off workers up to SG$6000 (USD$4,561) per month for six months, subject to conditions.
summary: The scheme will give laid off workers up to SG$6000 (USD$4,561) per month for six months, subject to conditions.

title: China blames Philippines for Coast Guard collision at Escoda Shoal, warns it to stop 'provocation'
content: The Chinese Coast Guard accused Philippine vessels of "illegally" intruding and colliding with one of their boats in waters near the Sabina Shoal on Monday.
summary: The Chinese Coast Guard accused Philippine vessels of "illegally" intruding and colliding with one of their boats in waters near the Sabina Shoal on Monday.

title: The first SpaceX spacewalk: What the Polaris Dawn commander says about the bold upcoming mission
content: The Polaris Dawn mission is the first of three flights Jared Isaacman bought from SpaceX in 2022 for his human spaceflight effort known as the Polaris Program.
summary: The Polaris Dawn mission is the first of three flights Jared Isaacman bought from SpaceX in 2022 for his human spaceflight effort known as the Polaris Program.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Wall Street 'dress rehearsal'
content: Markets were reassured that Japan's central bank will not raise rates in a volatile environment and that the U.S. economy isn't on the verge of a recession.

title: Why NASA astronauts are waiting to return on Boeing's Starliner
content: Boeing's Starliner capsule "Calypso" has been in space for 71 days and counting as the company and NASA try to identify whether its safe for its crew to return.
summary: Boeing's Starliner capsule "Calypso" has been in space for 71 days and counting as the company and NASA try to identify whether its safe for its crew to return.

title: To fix Starbucks, incoming CEO Brian Niccol will have to tackle its mobile app problem

title: Alibaba, JD.com results underscore the slowdown in Chinese consumer demand
content: Second-quarter results from Chinese e-commerce giants Alibaba and JD.com indicate a weak market, with domestic and foreign players struggling to attract customers.

title: China's new loans hit a 15-year low, but investors 'should not panic'
content: China extended just 260 billion yuan of new loans in July, far less than the 450 billion yuan expected.

title: Here's why Walgreens and CVS retail pharmacies are struggling — and what they're doing to fix it

title: Bayer shares soar 11% after key U.S. legal win against Roundup cancer claims
content: Bayer shares rose as the company said it scored a legal victory in its suit over claims that exposure to its popular Roundup weed killer led to cancer.

title: Earn less, relax more: An American who moved to Lithuania describes life in the world’s happiest country for young people

title: A $1.4 million vacation? Take a look inside a yacht that costs that much per week

But she can be yours for $1.4 million per week.
